output.crosstab_text:
For first degree graduates of English studies, one year after graduation, Education was the most common industry for White and Mixed ethnicity graduates, Wholesale and retail trade - repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles was the most common industry for Black, Asian and Other ethnicity graduates, and Accommodation and food service activities, Education, Human health and social work activities and Wholesale and retail trade - repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles were the most common industries for Not known ethnicity graduates.

The industry with the largest range in proportions was Wholesale and retail trade - repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles where Other ethnicity graduates had the highest proportion and Mixed ethnicity graduates had the lowest proportion. The industry with the largest range in median earnings was Information and communication where Asian ethnicity graduates had the highest median earnings (£23,700) and Black ethnicity graduates had the lowest median earnings (£14,600). The group with the highest earnings was Asian ethnicity graduates who worked in the Information and communication industry (median earnings of £23,700).
output.crosstab_title: Industry of graduate employment for graduates of English studies by ethnicity, one year after graduation, male and female first degree graduates from HE providers, 2020/21 tax year.
